rComments: I was terrified to participate in this ethics course at St Mary's College of California.  It was not a safe learning environment and she makes it clear through her body language non verbal cues that her personal opinion is the only right answer.  I had to tailor my assignments to align with her agenda in order to do well in the class.

In my experience she was more concerned with advancing her personal agenda than fostering a collaborative learning environment.  It appeared she held very strong anti-business and socialist beliefs which adversely affected my grade in the course.  4.0 student, received a C.  If I cared more I would have reported her. Avoid teacher at all costs.

While I was initially reluctant to take this class due to what I read on RMP, I'm glad I gave Judith a chance.  This was one of the best classes I took at UCSC, and an extremely important one.Not only do you learn how to manage across cultures, but also how to communicate more effectively. The reading assignments were great! def recommend this clas
I had a terrible time in her class; I am upset that there are professors like this at my school.
This could have been a great class but due to the lack of teaching ability it was a frustrating and awful,Please skip if poss.

I can understand why some have written the comments they have, but I felt that Judith was a very thoughtful and helpful person with those who actually cared about the class. She was totally approachable outside of class as well. You can get a good grade and not read most of the assigned reading. Judith's class was a pleasure : )
Avoid this instructor at ALL cost. You will regret taking her class. But then again if you want to experience the worst UCSC has to offer you should definitely enroll in one of her classes.

Business ethics was frustrating and VERY demanding.  I did get a lot out of the class but it wasn't due to Professor White's "lectures."  Very vague and disorganized.  Writing assignments were very contrived based on grading criteria.  Stick with it and participate in class, and WRITE YOUR PAPER TO THE RUBRIC!!!

Not helpful at all, and completely confusing when reiterating lectures in class. She doesn't listen to student requests and is extremely biased to what she wants to hear. DO NOT take her for the Merrill core course.
the worst professor I ever had. she's unfair and class is boring. graders do not have standards. professor is rude during class especially when students are expressing their thoughts.

extremely biased in the way she teaches the material. too much hw assignments, vague essay prompts and little to no good feedback on actual papers.- in addition to short HWs, four 4 page papers, one 8-10pg research paper and a final writing test. only way to get a decent grade is if you partcipate in class and get on her favs list.  avoid if poss

Made the mistake of having an argument with her and she threatened me saying "you in my book now" implying my grade will be altered. Very rude and impolite. Puts up a fake image for others to "accept" her but overall horrible terrible and I've had alot.
She epitomizes the disorganized bureaucracy that exists at UCSC, in the economics department in particular. Any self respecting department would not keep this woman around.
Professor White is a very good teacher, but she expects a lot out of her students. Be prepared to do a lot of HW, and be sure to participate in class discussions.

Worst teacher at UCSC. Terrible grading system combined with a lack of social skills makes her class so hard. Does not inspire people to think outside of her own opinions. Basically, if you don't agree with her, you don't get an A. Her assignments are vague and she has no set grading system. It amazing that the University still allows her to teach.

A lot of work. Close to 30 pages of writing a week. Many of her assignments are unclear, but she's always there to help. If you take the class be prepared to put time into the work, and if you do you can get a lot out of it.

She's a cool professor as long as you get your work done. Workload is composed of in-class quizzes, participation, homework and a final paper/presentation. Out of all of it, the final paper is tough because you have to form groups and have to work with an idiot or two. Otherwise, though, great teacher. Just put forth the effort and read.

She is not a fair grader and plays favorites. Even if u participate in class discussions and debates, you will still get an C in participation. She is extremely vague with her expectaions on homework performance. The class is not hard, but the way she grades it makes things a nightmare. Please stay away from business ethics! Worst econ class at SC

Very condescending. Rude and impolite to students.  Isn't interested in what students have to say. Idiotic grading system. Emphasizes that reading the texbook is not important because she spends about 10 min on each chapter a day.
